comment.narrative:
Output 1.1: MPA network in SE China expanded by 40,000 ha (including ESAs) and connectivity increased 113 MPAs (including nature reserves and marine special protected areas) have been established covering 2,260,541 ha in the coastal waters of Fujian, Guangdong and Guangxi Provinces (the project area). This represents 5.3% of the project area, which falls well below the international (10%) target, but in-line with the national (5%) target. These include 8 MPAs totaling 130,407ha specifically for CWD, yet even this is inadequate as some populations remain unprotected and there is little room for population expansion and recovery. Other globally significant biodiversity has received much less attention for coverge by MPAs due to gaps in information. The KBA approach has not yet been applied to the marine environment in China. While the process has started to define ecologically sensitive areas outside MPAs using the ecological red-lining system, no mechanism is yet in place to provide ecological connectivity between MPAs.
Output 1.2: Coastal biodiversity conservation mainstreamed into marine spatial planning Coastal biodiversity conservation currently focuses on single species (particularly CWD) or habitat conservation inside an inadequate and fragmented system of MPAs managed by multiple agencies at different levels with limited cooperation and communication. Biodiversity conservation is not adequately addressed in the surrounding seascapes which are allocated under marine spatial planning to other uses (aquaculture, tourism, fishing, industry etc). Some stakeholders may be unclear about their responsibilities for conserving biodiversity either in MPAs or wider seascapes, and/or may violate the rules when having the chance for short-term income; there are few mechanisms to secure their participation – particularly of the public. 1. Legal Framework and Expansion of MPA network a) The sub contract entitled “Feasibility analysis and investigation of the construction of marine protection land in Sanniang Bay, Guangxi” progressed well and the result will be shared with the Guangxi Forestry Bureau for decision making advice and technical support for the future establishment of a marine park in Sanniang Bay. b) The subcontract entitled “take Zhujiang River Estuary as example to explore the construction of Marine national parks” progressed well and the result will play a significant role on the establishment of Ocean Type National Park. c) The subcontract entitled “Technical support for the delimitation of ecological corridors in the coastal waters of Qinzhou-Behai” progressed well. The results of this mission will provide local conservation managers with new conservation ideas, and that more flexible seasonal and time-phased controls can be introduced for the protection of specific species and the temporary delimitation of protected areas, in an effort to expand the size of protected areas. d) the establishment of multi-stakeholder-involved CPBs in the three project provinces and regions promoted social participation, encourage public participation in conservation activities, and bring the impact of the project to the ground. 2. Demonstrations of improved MPA and ESA management a) The subcontract entitled “Preparation of the Integrated Management Plan for the Hepu Dugong National Nature Reserve in Guangxi and the Pearl River Estuary National Nature Reserve in Guangdong”. This mission contributes to improve the effectiveness of the management of project demonstration MPAs. Progressing well and the draft Management Plan have been submitted for comments. b) Professional training was provided by means of a series of subcontracts like “Action to clean beach” and “Capacity building plan and training materials &trail training”, which contributed to community-based conservation and livelihoods and the reduction of locally specific threats. c) Other subcontracts, such as the one entitled “Development of nature education textbook for Guangxi Hepu Dugong National Nature Reserve.”, have been awarded to different institutions and these activities aim at strengthening the capacity of MPA staff and the management effectiveness, and let MPAs are better managed and more effective. d) M&E and Knowledge Sharing i. The 2nd Project Steering Committee (PSC) Meeting was held and advices and suggestions for project activities and advanced project work at different levels were received. ii. the subcontract entitled “Develop an operationalized GIS database management and sharing system linking different MPAs” is in preparation, the result of which will provide technology support, improve efficiency and contribute to knowledge sharing. iii. The Gender Analysis and Action Plan has been updated. The plan aims to provide a direction to the project implementation team to ensure women and men in the C-PAR4 project equally participate in the project and receive culturally equitable social and economic benefits. iv. Other subcontracts in terms of video production will increase the impact of the project and raise public awareness effectively.

A subcontract entitled “take Zhujiang River Estuary as example to explore the construction of Marine national parks” has been awarded with Qingdao Blue Zhigu Marine science development center to contribute output1.1, to study PAs expand and update in Guangdong.
The TORs of Coastal Biodiversity Partnerships (CBPs) in three project provinces have been drafted, the suitable cooperation partner are being selected, the contracts will be awarded soon.
The work on the integration and optimization of national protected natural areas is still in progress. Through the preliminary work, a better comprehensive understanding of the base number of national PAs, optimized the spatial pattern of protected areas, and grasped the specific situations of various conflicts in protected areas, laying a solid foundation for the realization of the goal of comprehensive integration and optimization of protected areas in 2025. Project paid high attention to the progress of this work, and will carry out activities according relevant policies of protected areas in short future.
A subcontract entitled “Capacity building plan and training materials &trail training” has been awarded with Guangxi Academy of Sciences to contribute to output 2.1, the training materials will be used at least by demonstrated PAs and also will be extended through online trainings
A subcontract entitled “Action to clean beach” has been awarded with Sun Yat-sen University in December to contribute output2.3, baseline survey and two times of comparative surveys will be conducted to show the improvement through project activities on public awareness increasing. The video of this event has been broadcast on multiple platforms and received a good response.
The CTA paid filed visit in Fujian and Guangdong, to the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge, related PMA to have an intensive discussion with the administrations and surrounding communities for possible project participation and cooperation and public awareness increase as well
The short term consultant is in progress on METT baseline data adjustment, the updated METT baseline will be fixed soon.
A subcontract entitled “KAP surveys” has been awarded with China Agriculture university to contribute indicator 11, to monitor and assess the extent to which the public and policy makers understand the value of Marine protected areas.
